briefdescription.para: associated graph object
constructs a flow builder with a graph
creates a static task

detaileddescription.para:
C
callable type constructible from std::function<void()>
callable
callable to construct a static task
a tf::Task handle
The following example creates a static task.
Please refer to Static Tasking for details.

briefdescription.para: creates a dynamic task

detaileddescription.para:
C
callable type constructible from std::function<void(tf::Subflow&)>
callable
callable to construct a dynamic task
a tf::Task handle
The following example creates a dynamic task (tf::Subflow) that spawns two static tasks.
Please refer to Dynamic Tasking for details.

briefdescription.para: creates a condition task

detaileddescription.para:
C
callable type constructible from std::function<int()>
callable
callable to construct a condition task
a tf::Task handle
The following example creates an if-else block using one condition task and three static tasks.
Please refer to Conditional Tasking for details.

briefdescription.para: creates a multi-condition task

detaileddescription.para:
C
callable type constructible from std::function<tf::SmallVector<int>()>
callable
callable to construct a multi-condition task
a tf::Task handle
The following example creates a multi-condition task that selectively jumps to two successor tasks.
Please refer to Conditional Tasking for details.

briefdescription.para: creates multiple tasks from a list of callable objects

detaileddescription.para:
C
callable types
callables
one or multiple callable objects constructible from each task category
a tf::Task handle
The method returns a tuple of tasks each corresponding to the given callable target. You can use structured binding to get the return tasks one by one. The following example creates four static tasks and assign them to A, B, C, and D using structured binding.

briefdescription.para: removes a task from a taskflow

detaileddescription.para:
task
task to remove
Removes a task and its input and output dependencies from the graph associated with the flow builder. If the task does not belong to the graph, nothing will happen.

briefdescription.para: creates a module task for the target object

detaileddescription.para:
T
target object type
object
a custom object that defines the method T::graph()
a tf::Task handle
The example below demonstrates a taskflow composition using the composed_of method.

The taskflow object t2 is composed of another taskflow object t1, preceded by another static task init. When taskflow t2 is submitted to an executor, init will run first and then comp which spwans its definition in taskflow t1.
The target object being composed must define the method T::graph() that returns a reference to a graph object of type tf::Graph such that it can interact with the executor. For example:
Please refer to Composable Tasking for details.

briefdescription.para: creates a placeholder task

detaileddescription.para:
a tf::Task handle
A placeholder task maps to a node in the taskflow graph, but it does not have any callable work assigned yet. A placeholder task is different from an empty task handle that does not point to any node in a graph.

briefdescription.para: creates a runtime task

detaileddescription.para:
C
callable type constructible from std::function<void(tf::Runtime&)>
callable
callable to construct a runtime task
a tf::Task handle
The following example creates a runtime task that enables in-task control over the running executor.
Please refer to Runtime Tasking for details.

briefdescription.para: adds adjacent dependency links to a linear list of tasks

detaileddescription.para:
tasks
a vector of tasks
This member function creates linear dependencies over a vector of tasks.

briefdescription.para: adds adjacent dependency links to a linear list of tasks

detaileddescription.para:
tasks
an initializer list of tasks
This member function creates linear dependencies over a list of tasks.

memberdef.argsstring: (P &&policy, B first, E last, C callable)
memberdef.name: for_each

briefdescription.para: constructs an STL-styled parallel-for task

detaileddescription.para:
B
beginning iterator type
E
ending iterator type
C
callable type
P
policy type
first
iterator to the beginning (inclusive)
last
iterator to the end (exclusive)
callable
callable object to apply to the dereferenced iterator
policy
execution policy for scheduling parallel iterations
a tf::Task handle
The task spawns a subflow that applies the callable object to each object obtained by dereferencing every iterator in the range [first, last). This method is equivalent to the parallel execution of the following loop:
Arguments templated to enable stateful range using std::reference_wrapper. The callable needs to take a single argument of the dereferenced iterator type.
Please refer to Parallel Iterations for details.

briefdescription.para: Constructs a tf::FlowBuilder::for_each(P&&, B, E, C) task using the default execution policy tf::DefaultExecutionPolicy.

memberdef.argsstring: (P &&policy, B first, E last, S step, C callable)
memberdef.name: for_each_index

briefdescription.para: constructs an STL-styled index-based parallel-for task

detaileddescription.para:
B
beginning index type (must be integral)
E
ending index type (must be integral)
S
step type (must be integral)
C
callable type
P
policy type
first
index of the beginning (inclusive)
last
index of the end (exclusive)
step
step size
callable
callable object to apply to each valid index
policy
execution policy to schedule parallel iterations
a tf::Task handle
The task spawns a subflow that applies the callable object to each index in the range [first, last) with the step size. This method is equivalent to the parallel execution of the following loop:
Arguments are templated to enable stateful range using std::reference_wrapper. The callable needs to take a single argument of the integral index type.
Please refer to Parallel Iterations for details.

memberdef.argsstring: (B first, E last, S step, C callable)
memberdef.name: for_each_index

briefdescription.para: constructs a tf::FlowBuilder::for_each_index(P&&, B, E, S, C) task using the default execution policy tf::DefaultExecutionPolicy

memberdef.argsstring: (P &&policy, B first1, E last1, O d_first, C c)
memberdef.name: transform

briefdescription.para: constructs a parallel-transform task

detaileddescription.para:
B
beginning input iterator type
E
ending input iterator type
O
output iterator type
C
callable type
P
policy type
first1
iterator to the beginning of the first range
last1
iterator to the end of the first range
d_first
iterator to the beginning of the output range
c
an unary callable to apply to dereferenced input elements
policy
execution policy to schedule parallel iterations
a tf::Task handle
The task spawns a subflow that applies the callable object to an input range and stores the result in another output range. This method is equivalent to the parallel execution of the following loop:
Arguments are templated to enable stateful range using std::reference_wrapper. The callable needs to take a single argument of the dereferenced iterator type.

memberdef.argsstring: (B first1, E last1, O d_first, C c)
memberdef.name: transform

briefdescription.para: constructs a tf::FlowBuilder::transform(P&&, B, E, O, C) task using the default execution policy tf::DefaultExecutionPolicy

memberdef.argsstring: (P &&policy, B1 first1, E1 last1, B2 first2, O d_first, C c)
memberdef.name: transform

briefdescription.para: constructs a parallel-transform task

detaileddescription.para:
B1
beginning input iterator type for the first input range
E1
ending input iterator type for the first input range
B2
beginning input iterator type for the first second range
O
output iterator type
C
callable type
P
policy
first1
iterator to the beginning of the first input range
last1
iterator to the end of the first input range
first2
iterator to the beginning of the second input range
d_first
iterator to the beginning of the output range
c
a binary operator to apply to dereferenced input elements
policy
execution policy to schedule parallel iterations
a tf::Task handle
The task spawns a subflow that applies the callable object to two input ranges and stores the result in another output range. This method is equivalent to the parallel execution of the following loop:
Arguments are templated to enable stateful range using std::reference_wrapper. The callable needs to take two arguments of dereferenced elements from the two input ranges.

memberdef.argsstring: (B1 first1, E1 last1, B2 first2, O d_first, C c)
memberdef.name: transform

briefdescription.para: constructs a tf::FlowBuilder::transform(P&&, B1, E1, B2, O, C) task using the default execution policy tf::DefaultExecutionPolicy

memberdef.argsstring: (P &&policy, B first, E last, T &init, O bop)
memberdef.name: reduce

briefdescription.para: constructs a STL-styled parallel-reduce task

detaileddescription.para:
B
beginning iterator type
E
ending iterator type
T
result type
O
binary reducer type
P
policy type
first
iterator to the beginning (inclusive)
last
iterator to the end (exclusive)
init
initial value of the reduction and the storage for the reduced result
bop
binary operator that will be applied
policy
execution policy to schedule parallel iterations
a tf::Task handle
The task spawns a subflow to perform parallel reduction over init and the elements in the range [first, last). The reduced result is store in init. This method is equivalent to the parallel execution of the following loop:
Arguments are templated to enable stateful range using std::reference_wrapper.
Please refer to Parallel Reduction for details.

memberdef.argsstring: (B first, E last, T &init, O bop)
memberdef.name: reduce

briefdescription.para: constructs a tf::FlowBuilder::reduce(P&&, B, E, T&, O) task using the default execution policy tf::DefaultExecutionPolicy

memberdef.argsstring: (P &&policy, B first, E last, T &init, BOP bop, UOP uop)
memberdef.name: transform_reduce

briefdescription.para: constructs a STL-styled parallel transform-reduce task

detaileddescription.para:
B
beginning iterator type
E
ending iterator type
T
result type
BOP
binary reducer type
UOP
unary transformion type
P
policy type
first
iterator to the beginning (inclusive)
last
iterator to the end (exclusive)
init
initial value of the reduction and the storage for the reduced result
bop
binary operator that will be applied in unspecified order to the results of uop
uop
unary operator that will be applied to transform each element in the range to the result type
policy
execution policy to schedule parallel iterations
a tf::Task handle
The task spawns a subflow to perform parallel reduction over init and the transformed elements in the range [first, last). The reduced result is store in init. This method is equivalent to the parallel execution of the following loop:
Arguments are templated to enable stateful range using std::reference_wrapper.
Please refer to Parallel Reduction for details.

memberdef.argsstring: (B first, E last, T &init, BOP bop, UOP uop)
memberdef.name: transform_reduce

briefdescription.para: constructs a tf::FlowBuilder::transform_reduce(P&&, B, E, T&, BOP, UOP) task using the default execution policy tf::DefaultExecutionPolicy
constructs a dynamic task to perform STL-styled parallel sort

detaileddescription.para:
B
beginning iterator type (random-accessible)
E
ending iterator type (random-accessible)
C
comparator type
first
iterator to the beginning (inclusive)
last
iterator to the end (exclusive)
cmp
comparison function object
The task spawns a subflow to parallelly sort elements in the range [first, last).
Arguments are templated to enable stateful range using std::reference_wrapper.
Please refer to Parallel Sort for details.

briefdescription.para: constructs a dynamic task to perform STL-styled parallel sort using the std::less<T> comparator, where T is the element type

detaileddescription.para:
B
beginning iterator type (random-accessible)
E
ending iterator type (random-accessible)
first
iterator to the beginning (inclusive)
last
iterator to the end (exclusive)
The task spawns a subflow to parallelly sort elements in the range [first, last) using the std::less<T> comparator, where T is the dereferenced iterator type.
Arguments are templated to enable stateful range using std::reference_wrapper.
Please refer to Parallel Sort for details.

briefdescription.para: class to build a task dependency graph

detaileddescription.para: The class provides essential methods to construct a task dependency graph from which tf::Taskflow and tf::Subflow are derived.
